title: A Brush In The Teeth
opening: When journeying in from the borderlands, one particular peril would spring to mind: the Samsooth Mountains, whose gashing peaks rose up and divided the peninsula. Since before anyone could remember, the mountains had belonged to bandits, blights on the land whose acts of plunder, kidnapping, and arson knew no bounds. Out of fear, their victims gave these peaks another name: the Ghoul’s Teeth; while the bandits who ruled atop the Teeth’s craggy crowns took a name as well: the Samsooth Sires, or Soothsires...

intro.speaker: Julian
intro.line: Hey, c’mon, Lena, shake a leg! We need to get out of the Teeth, and we need to do it yesterday! Rumor has it the knights of Altea are at the foot of the mountain. We won’t get a better chance. It’s just a little bit farther. Stick with me.

intro.speaker: Lena
intro.line: Julian, I’m sorry...but I left my Mend staff back there. It’s very precious to me...You go on ahead...Save yourself! Here, I could use this Warp staff to send you someplace safe--

intro.speaker: Julian
intro.line: Uh-uh, honey. No can do. I didn’t betray my boys back there so you could zap me on out of here alone. Forget the staff; I’ll come back later and get it for you myself. All right? Right now though, I need you to RUN. Tick-tack, now move that frock!

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: Take care around mercenaries. They’re quite skillful; if you’re unlucky, they may drop you at stroke.

visit.speaker: Teenage Boy
visit.line: Units with high skill deal more frequent critical hits. Units with high speed have an easier time avoiding enemy attack.

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Hunters are stronger than archers, but they also have weaker defenses. Keep them out of close-range combat.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Oh, ho ho! Don’t you look young and full of life! Such a warm smile here deserves a nice reward. Here, take this axe—this EVIL abomination of an axe! Beware! Its blade drinks blood and devours flesh. I’d hate to see you come to any harm!”

recruit-battle.speaker: Navarre
recruit-battle.line: Will it be tears or blood you weep first?

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: Navarre! Since when does a swordsman of your caliber fall in with thieves and cutthroats?

recruit-talk.speaker: Navarre
recruit-talk.line: What? Who are you? Fly away, girl, before someone decides to swat you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: Please, Navarre. Why fight for nothing when you can fight for something? Leave this rabble. Lend your sword to our cause. Or, if you will not, then turn it on me now instead.

recruit-talk.speaker: Navarre
recruit-talk.line: ...Nay, I’ll turn no blade of mine on a women. If you’re willing to pay for my services with your life, then consider yourself the high bidder. My sword is yours.

battle-talk.speaker: Julian
battle-talk.line: Stop! Whoa! I’m...I’m not your enemy!

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Huh?

battle-talk.speaker: Julian
battle-talk.line: I’m Julian! One of the bad guys! A Soothsire. Oh! Well, except I’m not anymore. See, now I’m a good guy! Lena gave me a reason to--well, let’s just say I’ve had a change of heart.

battle-talk.speaker: Julian
battle-talk.line: Hm, not explainin’ myself very well, am I? OK OK, what I’m trying to say is--

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Yes. You can come with us.

battle-talk.speaker: Julian
battle-talk.line: Oh... Well... well, good.

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: I’m inclined to trust you. If you’ve truly had a change of heart, you deserve the chance to prove it. Show me you’re ready to help people, and then I’ll know I’ve picked a man of character.

battle-talk.speaker: Julian
battle-talk.line: Wow. That’s.... Thanks! I couldn’t ask for a better deal!

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Good day, Sister. Are you all right?

battle-talk.speaker: Lena
battle-talk.line: Yes... Thank you.

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: These mountains are dangerous. My forces will draw the enemy away; use that time to escape.

battle-talk.speaker: Lena
battle-talk.line: No, I wish to help.

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: But... you... What?

battle-talk.speaker: Lena
battle-talk.line: Please, sire. I am a cleric. I cannot bear to watch others come to harm when I have the power to help.

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Well... all right... But I don’t wish to see you come to harm, either.

battle-talk.speaker: Lena
battle-talk.line: I will be careful. Thank you, sire.

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Um, aren’t you--

battle-talk.speaker: Navarre
battle-talk.line: Navarre.

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: The great swordsman they speak of... Will you fight with us, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Navarre
battle-talk.line: You need only name your target.

boss.speaker: Reynard
boss.line: Har. You must really want to die, comin’ into the Soothsires’ palace unbidden!

boss.speaker: Reynard
boss.line: Arrgh... One day it’ll be you!

end.speaker: Malledus
end.line: Sire! Would you look at this! Those rogues left 15,000 gold here when they fled! This money will buy plenty of new equipment for your army. Tomorrow is the day, sire, when we finally arrive in Aurelis. Be sure to rest up tonight.
